page.title: 14BUTCHER'S ARMS
page.content: The Butchers Arms is one of two Public Houses situated in the village of Pontsticill.The building itself is three hundred years old and was farmerly two cottages each having one room upstairs and one room downstairs.The buuilding was converted and extended to create a small public house.the present landlord is a tenant as the public house is owned by the brewers Whitbread.The public houses has about two hundred regular customers who visit it on different evenings in the week.The most popular night is of course Saturdays when people from outside the village also come to the pub.Many foreign visitors call at the public house when passing through the village and in all people from 34 countries have visited the public house to date.
